content.description: understanding boolean expression (2016 Fall, Midterm 2, Question 6)

p.line: If the following expression is false, which can you say for sure?
Both A and B are false
Both A and B are true
A and B are the same

content.hint: When A is true the value of the expression is true, when A is false the outer OR would just be the value of the inner AND which would already be false if A is false, so B could be anything.
